result.execSummary:
The defendant Sanford C Mclaughlin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent. Do not associate with any known drug dealers or drug users.
Any assessments, counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

timeConds.notes: STAYED. Credit for time served only to be applied if revoked.

Defendant Sanford C Mclaughlin in court with attorney Pamela Popken.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Robin Anderson.
St- Plea to count 1, count 2 & count 3. Also move to orally amended the criminal complaint to remove the last sentence.
Rights Given
P- Guilty
BTC: Finding of guilt on count 1, count 2 & count 3.

Count 1- Withheld sentence, 2 Years Probation

Count 2- Withheld sentence, 2 Years Probation

Count 3- Withheld sentence, 2 Years Probation

Conditions:
5 Months RCJ - STAYED
No drugs, no alcohol
Do not associate with any known drug dealers or drug users
Maintain employment
Court costs on count 1, on count 2 & count 3 pay only the victim witness surcharge
Provide a DNA Sample & pay surcharge only on count 1 
Any assessments, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the agent
Credit for time served only to be applied if revoked
**NOTE:  Defendant was in custody from 12-23-2015 until 4-1-2016 for a total of 100 days credit for time served.**
Racine County Alternatives Program
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 28, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Letter to Defendant RE: Bond Monitoring
ZCI
Status conference on August 5, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

**AMENDED 4/1/2016 Must participate and comply with Mount Zion House Program. Can only be released to his sister Nola Starling Ratliff or his brother in law Troy Cobb. The defendant's sister or brother in law must transport the defendant to the program. Once the program is completed the defendant may reside at 5451 Emstan Hills Road.**
Status conference on June 14, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Sanford C Mclaughlin in court with attorney Pamela Popken.  Defendant Sanford C Mclaughlin in custody.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
Def- Defendant is ready to enter a treatment program. Request the bond be amended to a signature bond.
St- No objection.
BTC: $10,000 signature bond. Must participate and comply with Mount Zion House Program. Can only be released to his sister Nola Starling Ratliff or his brother in law Troy Cobb. They must transport the defendant to the program. Once the program is completed the defendant may reside at 5451 Emstan Hills Road. No drugs, no alcohol with ZCI to monitor.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time. Defendant Sanford C Mclaughlin in court with attorney Adrienne Michelle Moore.  Defendant Sanford C Mclaughlin in custody.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  
Defense objects to CT 1 based upon lack of probable cause. 
BTC: Motion to dismiss CT 1 is denied. Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.
